intro: Pentacalia tolimensis var. colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
